Comment: This poll feels like a turning point, not just another dip, but the first real signs that voters across the spectrum are starting to push back on Trump’s overreach. For years, his support base has seemed almost impervious to chaos. But now? The cracks are showing. The numbers aren’t just “bad.” They’re deeply revealing. Voters still support some of Trump’s core policies, including deportation, tariffs, and even slashing spending. But when they’re executed with zero restraint, that support collapses. People wanted a fighter, not a wrecking ball.  Look at immigration: 54% still support deporting undocumented immigrants, yet a majority disapprove of how he’s handling it. That’s not ideological opposition, that’s frustration with extremes. Same with executive power. When voters say a president is “scary” or “chaotic,” that’s not left vs. right, that’s an instinctive human reaction to leadership that feels dangerous.  And the economy? If his tariffs really do tip us into recession, this 42% approval rating might end up being the high point.  Bottom line: The Trump brand was built on the illusion of control, a strongman with a plan. But governing is different from campaigning. You can’t spin results forever. And this poll shows that even some of his own voters are waking up to that.
